metadata.title: CVE-2016-5733 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 4.0.xbefore 4.0.10.16, 4.4.x before 4.4.15.7, and 4.6.x before 4.6.3 allowremote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectorsinvolving (1) a crafted table name that is mishandled during privilegechecking in table_row.phtml, (2) a crafted mysqld log_bin directive that ismishandled in log_selector.phtml, (3) the Transformation implementation,(4) AJAX error handling in js/ajax.js, (5) the Designer implementation, (6)the charts implementation in js/tbl_chart.js, or (7) the zoom-searchimplementation in rows_zoom.phtml.

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
